thread.title: Experian Sells Banking Software Firm Baker Hill to Riverside For $100 Million
thread.title_full: Experian Sells Banking Software Firm Baker Hill to Riverside For $100 Million

author: morningstar.com
title: Experian Sells Banking Software Firm Baker Hill to Riverside For $100 Million
text:
LONDON--Credit checking and information services firm Experian PLC (EXPN.LN) Wednesday said it agreed to sell Baker Hill, a supplier of asset management software, to private equity firm Riverside Co. for $100 million.
"The sale of Baker Hill is another step in our group strategy to focus on our larger businesses and geographies," said Brian Cassin, chief executive of Dublin-headquartered Experian.
Baker Hill, which serves regional and community banks in the U.S., reported sales of $31 million for the 2015 financial year.
At 1407 GMT, shares in Experian traded eight pence or 0.7% higher at 1,083 pence.
Write to Ed Ballard at ed.ballard@wsj.com
September 02, 2015 10:26 ET (14:26
